articles.headline: Bridging Gaps Early On in Oklahoma
articles.snippet: The state’s voluntary public preschool program, which 70 percent of 4-year-olds attend, is one of the most serious attempts to deal with economic inequality anywhere in the country.
articles.abstract: The state’s voluntary public preschool program, which 70 percent of 4-year-olds attend, is one of the most serious attempts to deal with economic inequality anywhere in the country.

articles.headline: From Spaceflight to Attempted Murder Charge
articles.snippet: A NASA astronaut, Capt. Lisa Marie Nowak, has been charged with the attempted murder of a rival for the affections of a fellow astronaut.
articles.abstract: A NASA astronaut, Capt. Lisa Marie Nowak, has been charged with the attempted murder of a rival for the affections of a fellow astronaut.
articles.lead_paragraph: Like most of today’s astronauts, Lisa Marie Nowak worked in relative obscurity — even last July, when she took the spaceflight that she had spent 10 years at NASA hoping for.

articles.headline: Shareholder Vote Today Could Settle Fight for Office REIT
articles.snippet: The Blackstone Group leads Vornado Realty Trust in the bidding for Equity Office Properties Trust, the nation’s largest office landlord.
articles.abstract: The Blackstone Group leads Vornado Realty Trust in the bidding for Equity Office Properties Trust, the nation’s largest office landlord.
articles.lead_paragraph: The feverish competition over Equity Office Properties Trust, the nation’s largest office landlord, appeared to be nearing an end yesterday, with the original suitor, the Blackstone Group, leading the bidding.

articles.headline: As Inflation Soars, Zimbabwe Economy Plunges
articles.snippet: Hyperinflation has bankrupted the government, left 8 in 10 citizens destitute and decimated factories and farms.
articles.abstract: Hyperinflation has bankrupted the government, left 8 in 10 citizens destitute and decimated factories and farms.
articles.lead_paragraph: JOHANNESBURG, Feb. 6  For close to seven years, Zimbabwe’s economy and quality of life have been in slow, uninterrupted decline. They are still declining this year, people there say, with one notable difference: the pace is no longer so slow.

articles.headline: Jobs Calls for End to Music Copy Protection
articles.snippet: Apple’s chief said record companies should allow songs to be sold online without anticopying software, in part because the technology does not stop piracy.
articles.abstract: Apple’s chief said record companies should allow songs to be sold online without anticopying software, in part because the technology does not stop piracy.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 6 — Steven P. Jobs, Apple’s chief executive, jolted the record industry on Tuesday by calling on its largest companies to allow online music sales unfettered by antipiracy software.

articles.headline: G.E. Finds Strength in Its Diversity
articles.snippet: The company’s acquisitions in growth platforms mean more technologies to tap into for use in its other businesses.
articles.abstract: The company’s acquisitions in growth platforms mean more technologies to tap into for use in its other businesses.
articles.lead_paragraph: NISKAYUNA, N.Y. — Christoph Hergersberg stands before a wall-size diagram with far too many arrows, symbols and letters for an untutored eye to decipher.

articles.headline: Allied Records Are Subpoenaed in ‘Pretexting’ Case
articles.snippet: Prosecutors want to know whether the business development company obtained the phone records of a critic through impersonation.
articles.abstract: Prosecutors want to know whether the business development company obtained the phone records of a critic through impersonation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors have subpoenaed records of Allied Capital, a business development company that provides financing to smaller firms, in an effort to discover how private investigators it hired may have obtained the phone records of one of its leading critics.
